description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
Course Description  
This course aims to develop student’s English proficiency regarding all four language skills. Students  
are expected to increase their reading and writing literacy along with listening comprehension and  
communication competence through a variety of in-class and out-of-class activities.

**Textbook**

    Macintyre, Paul & Bohlke, David. (2019). Reading Explorer: Book 2 (Third Edition). National  
Geographic Learning.

Requirements and Rules  
1\. Punctual attendance, lesson preparation and active participation are required. Participation  
also includes teamwork and group discussion.  
All absences will be classified as excused or unexcused.  
Absences for the following reasons will be excused if there is timely verification  
(within 1 week) of such reasons provided to the instructor:  
Illness or medical emergency  
Family emergencies  
Pre-arranged medical appointments.  
Pre-arranged school-sponsored activities, such as field trips.  
A Notification of Absence Form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統) within 1  
week. Verification document (hard-copy) should also be handed in to the instructor  
within 1 week. Late submission will not be accepted.  
Students who are more than 30 minutes late to class will be considered absent.  
Students will fail this course if there are more than 3 unexcused absences.  
Students will fail this course if they miss more than 5 meetings the whole semester.  
2\. Plagiarism and cheating on quizzes or exams is absolutely forbidden. If someone is found cheating on  
an exam, he/she will fail that exam.  
3\. Textbook is a must. Violation of this rule will cost you 2 points (out of your final score) each time.  
4\. You cannot use your laptop or smart phone in class without the teacher’s permission. Violation of this  
rule will cost you 2 points each time.  
5\. Before every meeting, you must preview the reading. Look up the words that you don’t know in the  
dictionary and write down their meanings. Then read the paragraphs out loud. Try to get the main point  
of each paragraph. I’ll check whether you have done all the preview tasks in class. Those who fail to do  
what is required will lose one point each time.  
6\. The whole class will be divided into 6 groups. Each group picks one person who is competent and

responsible to be their leader. In every meeting, the leader checks his group members’ textbooks for me  
to see if each of them has looked up the new words in the dictionary and written their meanings on the  
book. Then he goes over the text to see if each one understands everything. After that, some students will  
be randomly called to read aloud or translate the text and answer the comprehension questions. If they  
cannot do the task well, they’ll get some assignment to do after class. Then some follow-up questions  
will be raised for further discussion. Each discussion session will last 15 minutes. Exchange your  
opinions within your group and contribute your ideas. Each time the group must assign one member to  
give a report of their discussion and his/her report will constitute 5 points of his/her final score.  
7\. This semester you have to turn in an autobiography (with at least 100 words) and a written  
reflection on the assigned Lexile reading. Print them out on an A4 paper and submit them to me  
as scheduled.  
8\. A speaking activity – Show and Tell: My Favorite X -- will be held on 10/18. Share one of your  
favorite topics with your classmates. You can use multimedia and all kinds of resources (props,  
costumes, photos, etc.) to make your presentation interesting to the audience. It must be done in  
English and last at least 2 minutes. An example is given in the appendix.  
9\. This semester we won’t have a written midterm exam. Instead, we’ll have an oral report of a study  
you do about the topics discussed in class. Choose one of the topics and do some research about it.  
Then present your study to the class. In your presentation, tell the class what motivates you to do  
such a study, what is your study method, what are your major findings and what suggestions you  
can provide. Your report should be about 2.5 minutes long.  
10\. In order to improve your extensive reading skills and discussion skills, one Lexile book will be  
assigned as an outside reading for you to practice discussing on 12/11. Before the event, the teacher  
will briefly introduce the essence of quality talk and the most frequently used 6 types of questions.  
Each student must try to ask as many questions as possible, proving that they really understand how  
to ask questions in order to elicit important information and stimulate further thoughts. They write  
down their questions on a paper before coming to class. In class, they take turns asking their group  
members the questions. While doing the task, they work together, thinking about which questions  
are important and inspiring enough to be included. After that, they hand in a paper with all the  
questions fitting the 6 categories and their answers on it. This assignment is due on 12/18 and  
constitutes 5 points. Then each student writes down his/her thought about the book on an A4 paper  
and submit it to me on 12/18 too. This will constitute another 5 points.  
11\. At the end of the term, the leader rates his/her group members’ degree of engagement in the  
discussion and their overall contribution on a 0–5 scale. In addition, in order to push the students  
to enlarge their word bank, a vocabulary test will be held to see how many important words the  
students have learned. The test result constitutes 10 points. Now that the vocabulary is singled  
out and tested beforehand, the final exam will be intended to test only their reading ability and  
writing ability. Likewise, there will be a reading-aloud test in order to push the students to open  
their mouths and read English out loud. Every student will be required to read aloud a paragraph  
chosen from the readings in the textbook. Their performance in the test will constitute 5 points.  
12\. Check Moodle 2.8 and email frequently  
I assume that you check your email and the course site frequently. It’s your responsibility to  
make sure you register with the correct email address on Moodle 2.8. Not receiving a notice is  
NOT an excuse for any late submission. Late submission will be penalized 10% per day.

Grading Policies

Attendance and Participation 10%  
Show and Tell: My Favorite X (10/23) 10%  
Vocabulary Test (1/08) 10%  
Autobiography (10/16) & Reflection on the Lexile Reading (12/18) 10%  
Reading Aloud (12/04) 5%  
Report of the Discussion 5%  
Questions for the Outside Reading and Their Answers (12/18) 5%  
Peer Evaluation (1/08 degree of involvement and contribution) 5%  
Oral Presentation of Your Study (11/13) 20%  
Final Exam (1/15) 20%

Bonus Points (for those who can’t get 60 points in the Final Exam)  
1\. Time spent on the multimedia lab樸101 or chatroom may help you earn some bonus points.  
2\. Extra points will be given if you participate in activities that help improve your English ability, such  
as Spelling Bee, Reading Aloud Competition, 3-minute presentations competition, E-book  
competition, listening to English talks, i-read or language exchange, etc. How many points you’ll get  
depends on the length of time and efforts you spend on them.  
3\. Summaries of the Lexile outside readings.
